alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 3:36AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, Surfside Beach, Red Hill, Socastee, Myrtle Beach Airport, Garden City, Murrells Inlet, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Forestbrook, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Coastal Carolina University, Bucksville, Nixonville, Bucksport, Burgess, Hand, Hammond, Dongola and Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
